name: Grand Rotana Resort & Spa

reviews.text: i am a travel agent myself and stayed here for a few days on an overseas busines trip, i have to say i thought the hotel was fantastic right on a lovely coral reef ideal for your snokelling, massive outdoor pool area with certainly more than enough loungers etc. The spa was amazing and a certainnly recommend a full body massage it was out of this world! Jetty's out to the reef which is marked off so you are fairly safe to swim. Very good resturants, highly recommend Silk Road and the indian food, had a buter chicken curry better than here!! Will definately be returning with my family in the near future. One other point i feel i must mention, on arrival I was quite poorly with a tummy bug, at a lunch i was sitting next to the manager and he asked how i was. When i told him i went back to my room to find some tablets from the local docter delivered free of charge and they really did work!! I must stress i was NOT ill from this hotel though and the food was well above any standard you would get here. They have a fantastic kids club and a pony station for the little ones, also a fairly big sized gym. Saw all room types on our inspection and they were all of a good size, if you have loads of cash definately go for the royal suite though, oh my god it was amazing!! Hope this review helps and I would definately recommend.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel last week of May and first week of June 2007. Chose the hotel on the strength of the quality at other Rotana hotels I had used previously in the UAE where I had been impressed with decor, restaurant cuisine and staff attitude.
reviews.title: Do's and Dont's - This is my truth....

likes.liked: — The overall quality of the resort, the food and staff attitude.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, this is a "resort" not a hotel - therefore the accommodation is spread out across the "resort" and not just contained to a couple of central apartment blocks. Golf buggies transport you around the resort with a quick call to concierge services if mobility is an issue. But nothing is really more than 5 - 10 minutes walk from your room at the very most.
reviews.title: Don't recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DO check travel agents as well as internet sites when booking up. I approached the hotel direct secured the cheapest deal through a UK based Travel Agent. Although you have to suffer package holiday flight hell – delays and cramped seating. Some scheduled services are available though if you want to string things together independently.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay with a few problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DONT pay for premium transfer service with travel agent if staying at this resort. Journey time from airport is only 10-15 mins max - pick up a cab at airport or suffer the package deal coach - it's not for long and ours only had 10 passengers on the outward journey - although became crowded on the return trip.
reviews.title: Lives up to 5 Star Rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, where do I start. First of all what a stay. We went to Rotana for 1 week B&B, we had a great time.
reviews.title: Super Stay

reviews.text: The resort is 15mins away from Sharm airport. If you are planning on spending all your time time Sharm (no visits to Cairo/Pyramids) then YOU DO NOT NEED A VISA. Once you get your bag, go straight to passport control and they'll stamp your passport. Just tell them you are not leaving Sharm.
reviews.title: great value for money
Not Be Rushing Back
reviews.text: Okay, once you get to Rotana, it can be confusing and you might feel lost initially, the place is huge. Its a resort and not a hotel don't forget. The staff were very friendly, rooms clean and spacious. We did have a problem with rooms not being cleaned before the afternoon, but we spoke to management about this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You cannot leave the hotel as its quite secluded, there is no option to go for a walk or anything as there is just a main road nearby.
reviews.title: Not bad!!!

likes.disliked: — the race to get a sunbed every morning and noise around our room every night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went B&B which was ideal for us as we're not big lunch eaters. The hotel as 3 restaurants, Ramses (which is where all the buffets are for breaky, lunch and dinner), Silk Road (Asian Fusion and Mezzaine (Italian Style). There is also room service which has a different menu. If you go B&B you'll have breaky in Ramses, breakfast was good, all options available (bread,fruit, meat, cereal...). There are also 3 bars in the resort.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the resort for the first two weeks in july having checked the reviews on trip advisor. We booked a delux room with a sea view requested but were upgraded to a premier on arrival. The room was spacious, tastefully decorated / furnished and very comfortable. Our bathroom had a large stone tiled walk-in shower but no bath ( not that it mattered), as some of the rooms on the candid photo's seem to have. One word of warning, the hot water was scolding and could be a danger if you had young children.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a first floor balcony overlooking the sea but to be honest it was so hot in the afternoon you couldn't really use it to relax.
reviews.title: Out of this world!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, friendliness of staff, modern accomodation

reviews.text: We saw quite a few people with horrendous mosquito bites but we didn't have any, possibly due to the location of the room?
reviews.title: A fantastic 5 star holiday!

likes.disliked: — Our toilet as it kept blocking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was good as was the food at the pool area.
reviews.title: Fanatastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at Mezzaluna a couple of times and found the food good but the menu limited. Silk Road was very good but it is very expensive by Egyptian standards.
reviews.title: Fantastic Honeymoon!
Disappointing for 5*
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Rotana for a week in April. Just a couple of points which we found while visiting. After booking a delux pool view room, on arrival at hotel we were told they were upgrading our room to a sea view but the room was not ready, after waiting 30 mins we were taken to our 'upgraded room' only to find it was quite a distance from the pool area and although it had a sea view, we soon realised that all the pool view rooms also have sea views! Possible con?? Would like to have viewed our original choice of room to see the difference inside as the 'upgraded room' was nothing special.
The hotel staff are very friendly and most speak reasonably good English however, not enough staff serving at the pool area during the day for the size of the hotel.
reviews.title: Grand Rotana Resort and Spa Sharm

likes.liked: — The sheer luxury and fantastic service from the Egyptian staff, who were faultless.
likes.disliked: — A bit more evening atmosphere would have been good.

reviews.text: Also the usual drama to get a sunbed at the pool area, if your not down by 8am, forget it!
reviews.title: Enjoy The Rotana But...
Pretending to be a 5 star
reviews.text: The food in the hotel was, we felt, very disappointing both in the main restaurant and by the pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We both work in the airline industry and therefore travel extensively and both felt that the hotel, although has all the facilities of a 5*, was more accurately a 4*.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed this Hotel

aka: Grand Rotana Hotel Sharm El Sheikh
